articles.title: ‘Ride and Walk for Your Life’ pedals toward safer streets, will push for reform
articles.description:
"Ride and Walk for Your Life Boston" events include a memorial bike ride, a memorial walk, and a rally at the State House, organizers said in a press release. 

The post ‘Ride and Walk for Your Life’ pedals toward safer streets, will push for reform appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Organizers will host a memorial bike ride and walk on November 11.
The event aims to promote safer streets for Boston residents.
A rally at the State House will advocate for transportation reform.

articles.title: Tips for getting stubborn bird droppings off of an SUV
articles.description:
John Paul, AAA Northeast's Car Doctor, answers a question from a reader frustrated with some cement-like droppings discovered on their Jeep.

The post Tips for getting stubborn bird droppings off of an SUV appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: John Paul from AAA Northeast provides tips for removing bird droppings from vehicles.
Readers can learn effective cleaning methods to protect their SUVs from damage.
Boston residents can maintain vehicle appearance and value with proper care techniques.

articles.title: Patriots have a new secret weapon on offense in 335-pound defensive tackle
articles.description:
"Best two-way player in the league, if you ask me."

The post Patriots have a new secret weapon on offense in 335-pound defensive tackle appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Patriots' Khyiris Tonga, a 335-pound defensive tackle, joins offense as a versatile player.
Coach Mike Vrabel calls Tonga the best two-way player in the league.
Boston fans can expect innovative plays that enhance the team's offensive strategy.

articles.title: There’s no timeline on when flight cuts will ease up after the government shutdown ends
articles.description:
Airlines have canceled over 9,000 flights across the U.S. since the Federal Aviation Administration ordered flight cuts late last week

The post There’s no timeline on when flight cuts will ease up after the government shutdown ends appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Airlines canceled over 9,000 flights nationwide due to FAA flight cuts.
Boston travelers face ongoing disruptions with no timeline for resolution.
Local airports may experience increased congestion as cancellations continue.

articles.title: What Joe Thornton said about the Bruins during his Hall of Fame induction speech
articles.description:
"To the people of Boston, you were so good to me."

The post What Joe Thornton said about the Bruins during his Hall of Fame induction speech appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Joe Thornton thanked Boston fans during his Hall of Fame induction on November 11, 2025.
Thornton expressed gratitude for the support he received while playing for the Bruins.
His speech reinforces Boston's strong hockey culture and community pride.

articles.title: Several key Patriots players still limited in latest injury report
articles.description:
Key players like Kayshon Boutte and Rhamondre Stevenson remain limited on New England's latest injury report.

The post Several key Patriots players still limited in latest injury report appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Kayshon Boutte and Rhamondre Stevenson are limited in practice ahead of the upcoming game.
Injuries may affect the Patriots' performance against their next opponent this Sunday.
Fans should monitor these players' statuses for potential impact on game day.
